In this unit we are continuing to explore rational numbers, including operations and their properties with positive, negative numbers and zero and how to recognize and use these operations to solve problems. At the end of this Investigation,

What do you know about rational numbers and their operations?

Students should have informal methods for adding and subtracting integers using real world contexts, games, number lines, and chip boards. In Investigation 2, this will be formalized to include all the cases: two negatives, two positive, negative and positive, positive and negative.

Notice:

  • Students should know that the sum of two opposite numbers is zero (Additive Inverse Property a + (-a) = 0)
  • Students should have begun to make a connection between addition and subtraction with positive and negative numbers.
